wikipedia_page.main: Robert Duncombe Shafto (1796 – 22 March 1889) was a British Liberal Party politician.  He was Member of Parliament (MP) for North Durham from 1847 to 1868.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1852 United Kingdom general election

response: *Robert Duncombe Shafto (1796–1888), English politician, MP for North Durham 1847–1888

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1857 United Kingdom general election

response: Their son Robert Duncombe Shafto (1796-1888), was member for North Durham 1847–68. His son Robert Charles died in 1909 without a male heir. His daughter Rosa married her cousin Robert Charles Duncombe Shafto (b1879), second son of Rev Slingsby Duncombe Shafto of Beamish. The Hall at Whitworth was severely damaged by fire in 1872 and apart from the library wing, was demolished and replaced with a new house about 1900. The estate was sold by the family in 1981.
*Robert Duncombe Shafto (1796–1888), British Liberal Party politician
